The Elder Dhammaruci’s Birth Story
“When Dīpaṅkara, the Buddha,
the Victor, declared Sumedha,
‘After an immeasurable aeon,
this one will become a Buddha.
His mother who will give birth to him,
will be called Māyā;
His father will be called Suddhodana,
and he will be called Gotama.
Having undertaken the struggle,
having done what is difficult to do,
at the foot of the Assattha tree,
the greatly famous one will awaken.
Upatissa and Kolita,
will be his chief disciples;
one called Ānanda,
will attend on the Victor.
Khemā and Uppalavaṇṇā,
will be his chief female disciples;
Citto and Hatthāḷavaka,
will be his chief male lay disciples.
Khujjuttarā and Nandamātā,
will be his chief female lay disciples;
the Awakening of this hero,
is called the Assattha tree’.
Having heard this statement,
of the Great Sage,
the humans and the gods were delighted,
and they worshipped with hands together in respect.
At that time I was a young brāhmaṇa,
Megha was well-trained;
Having heard the best explanation,
of the great sage Sumedha.
Having become separated,
from the compassionate Sumedha;
And when that hero went forth,
I went forth with him.
Restrained in the Pāṭimokkha,
and in the five senses;
The pure-living, mindful hero,
was a doer of the Jina’s instruction.

Having seen a ship in the ocean,
I came to it for my livelihood.
